snippet: The bankrupt maker of cream-filled pastries like Twinkies and Ho Hos said on Friday that it planned to liquidate, a week after one of the company's biggest unions went on strike to protest a labor contract.
abstract: The bankrupt maker of cream-filled pastries like Twinkies and Ho Hos said on Friday that it planned to liquidate, a week after one of the company's biggest unions went on strike to protest a labor contract.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and STEVEN GREENHOUSE

headline.main: As Labor Talks Collapse, Hostess Turns Out Lights
headline.print_headline: A Push to Save the Twinkies: As Labor Talks Collapse, Hostess Turns Out Lights

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bakery, Confectionery, Tobacco Workers and Grain Millers International Union
